column.name: MARKET_CODE
column.comment: Market to which the customer is assigned. Examples are MMC (credit customers who have a contract with VfD2), PUC (credit customers who have a contract with a partner company), MMO (prepaid customers who are directly assigned to VfD2), PUA (prepdaid custom

column.name: BAN
column.comment: A unique number that identifies the BAN to which the adjustment is granted.

column.name: ENT_SEQ_NO
column.comment: A unique number that identifies the adjustment within the BAN.

column.name: ACTV_SEQ_NO
column.comment: A unique number that distinguishes between different adjustment activities performed on the same adjustment.

column.name: SYS_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: Date of creation of the data record in the operative system

column.name: SYS_UPDATE_DATE
column.comment: Date of modification of the data record in the operative system

column.name: OPERATOR_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the last user

column.name: APPLICATION_ID
column.comment: Unique ID of the application that last processed the sentence

column.name: EU_ACTV_AMT
column.comment: The amount of the adjustment (excluding tax) in Euro.

column.name: BALANCE_IMPACT_CODE
column.comment:
Indicates whether the adjustment affects the account immediately or on the next bill day.

a. “B” - Adjustment affects the account on the next bill day;
b. “I” - Adjustment affects the account immediately.

The value is set when the adjustment is created.

column.name: ADJ_LEVEL_CODE
column.comment:
Indicates the level of adjustment (i.e., to which type of debts the adjustment is applied).

a. “M” - Message-related adjustment.
b. “C” - Charge-related adjustment.
c. “A” - Account-related adjustment.

Set when the adjustment is created.

column.name: ACTV_CODE
column.comment:
The code of the activity (i.e., adjustment, adjustment reversal, dispute).

The value of the attribute is set according to the activity performed when the entity is created.

column.name: ACTV_REASON_CODE
column.comment:
Indicates the reason for the adjustment activity.

A valid adjustment reason code. The valid reasons are defined in the Adjustment Reason table, which defines all the reasons supported by the system.

The value for the attribute is set when the entity is created.

column.name: ACTV_DATE
column.comment:
The date on which the adjustment is applied or reversed.
A valid date.
Set to run-date, when the adjustment is applied. The attribute is updated whenever the adjustment entity is updated.

column.name: ACTV_BILL_SEQ_NO
column.comment:
Contains the sequential number of the bill on which the adjustment activity or the reversal activity should be reported.

This is a valid Bill Sequential number.

Set when the adjustment is created or reversed.

column.name: ADJ_CREATION_DATE
column.comment: The date on which the adjustment is created.

column.name: GL_EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: The date on which the adjustment should be reported to the G/L.

column.name: INV_SEQ_NO
column.comment:
Contains the Invoice Item ID to which the adjustment is applied. It is relevant for an adjustment to message, charge or invoice. The invoice level and message level adjustments are connected directly to the relevant invoice. The Charge-Related adjustments are actually connected to an invoice through the appropriate charge, since they affect this invoice. The invoice ID is registered on these adjustments to simplify access to them from the invoice.

A valid Invoice Item ID - for message, charge and invoice level adjustments.Zero/Null - For account level adjustments.

For invoice level adjustments, the attribute is set upon the creation of the adjustment.

For message and charge level adjustments, the attribute is set upon application of the adjustment.

column.name: SOURCE_APPL_CODE
PRIOD_CVRG_ST_DATE
column.comment: Indicates the start date of the period to which the adjustment refers. It is relevant for an adjustment that credits the customer for a specific period of time.

column.name: PRIOD_CVRG_ND_DATE
column.comment: Indicates the end date of the period to which the adjustment refers. It is relevant for an adjustment that credits the customer for a specific period of time.

column.name: MEMO_ID
column.comment: Contains the ID of the memo, which contains additional documentation for the adjustment. It is relevant for an adjustment generated online.

column.name: CHARGE_SEQ_NO
column.comment: Indicates whether or not a charge-related adjustment is connected to a charge, and if so, identifies the relevant charge.

column.name: SUBSCRIBER_NO
column.comment:
Contains the subscriber number to which the adjustment is related.

A valid subscriber number. Blank - when not relevant.

If the adjustment is related to a message, the attribute is set to the appropriate CTN. If the adjustment is charge-related, this attribute is set to the subscriber number of the relevant charge. If the adjustment is at account level, the attribute is not populated.

column.name: SUB_MARKET_CD
column.comment: Contains the sub-market to which the adjusted charge or message  belongs.

column.name: SOC
column.comment:
Contains the Service Order Code (SOC) of the charge to which the adjustment is related, or the SOC to which the message is rated.

The attribute is validated against the SOC table (of the Price Plan area) which defines the various SOCs.

For a message- related adjustment, this attribute is set to the SOC according to which the message is rated.

For a charge-related adjustment, this attribute is set to the SOC of the related charge, which can be specified when creating the adjustment online.

If the adjustment is at the account level, the attribute is not populated.

column.name: FEATURE_CODE
column.comment:
Contains the feature code of the charge (or message) to which the adjustment is related.

The attribute is validated against the Feature table (of the Price Plan area) which defines the various feature types. 

For a message- related adjustment, this attribute is set to the code of the feature, according to which the message is rated.

For a charge-related adjustment, this attribute is set to the feature code of the related charge.

If the adjustment is account level, the attribute is not populated.

column.name: FTR_REVENUE_CODE
column.comment:
Contains the feature revenue code of the charge (or message) to which the adjustment is related.

The attribute is validated against the Feature Revenue table of the Price Plan area.

For a message-related adjustment, this attribute is set to the code 'U' - usage.

For a charge-related adjustment, this attribute is set to the revenue feature code of the related charge.

If the adjustment is at the account level, the attribute is not populated.

column.name: SERVICE_FTR_SEQ_NO
column.comment: Contains the service feature sequential number of the charge (or message) to which the adjustment is related.

column.name: SOURCE_BILL_SEQ_NO
column.comment: Contains the sequential number of the bill on which the adjusted activity was reported

column.name: DISCOUNT_CD
column.comment: Indicates the Price Plan Discount Code.

column.name: CHANNEL_SEIZURE_DT
column.comment: Contains the date and time of channel seizure. This attribute is part of the key that uniquely identifies the usage entity.

column.name: MESSAGE_SWITCH_ID
column.comment: Contains the code that identifies the switch that generates the call record. This attribute is part of the key that uniquely identifies the usage entity.

column.name: MSG_EXIST_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the adjusted call details exist.

column.name: AT_CALL_DUR_ROND_MIN
column.comment: Adjusted call duration.

column.name: AT_CALL_START_PERIOD
column.comment: The period in which the call started.

column.name: AT_CALL_END_PERIOD
column.comment: The period in which the call ended.

column.name: B_NUMBER
column.comment: The called party telephone number (without leading zeros).

column.name: PRODUCT_TYPE
column.comment: The type of product registered in the usage.

column.name: TAX_CODE
column.comment:
Tax code

S - standard
Z - zero-rated
E - exempt

column.name: TAX_PERCENT_RATE
column.comment: Tax percent rate

column.name: EU_TAX_AMT
column.comment: Tax amount

column.name: CALL_ACTION_CODE
column.comment: Data from the usage.

column.name: BILL_COMMENT
column.comment: Text displayed on the bill.

column.name: CONV_RUN_NO
column.comment: For conversion purposes.

column.name: MANUAL_OVERRIDE_IND
column.comment:
Indicates whether the adjustment was calculated by the system or manually changed by the rep.
"Y" - By the system;
"N" - By the rep.
Where applicable, the field will be populated by the application creating the adjustment.

column.name: SOC_SEQ_NO
column.comment: Used as a link between the adjustment and the customer area.

column.name: BL_IGNORE_IND
column.comment: Indicates whether the adjustment should be displayed on the bill.

column.name: CHARGE_TYPE
column.comment: The type of charge in case of charge level adjustment

column.name: DISCOUNT_PCT
column.comment: The percentage of discount.

column.name: FINANCE_EFF_DATE
column.comment: The date on which the financial transaction is effective for the dealer. For future use.

column.name: RMS_INV_STORE_ID
column.comment: For future use.

column.name: RMS_INV_ACTV_TYPE
column.comment: For future use.

column.name: RMS_INV_ID
column.comment: For future use.

column.name: QUANTITY
column.comment:
The quantity of features of the same type covered by the charge. This is used by Bill Production for bill display purposes. The value of the field is taken from the Service_Feature table. When calculating the actv_amt of the charge, the quantity is multiplied by the rate.
 The field is not is use.

column.name: DEPARTMENT
column.comment: The department in which the BAN has been activated.

column.name: ADJ_DSP_STATUS
column.comment: The status of the dispute.

column.name: DSP_SCDL_CNCL_DATE
column.comment: The date when a rejected dispute should be cancelled by the Dispute Handling process.

column.name: ORIGINAL_CURRENCY
column.comment: The currency used when keying the adjustment.

column.name: DSP_AUT_ACTION_DAT
column.comment: The date on which the automatic action will be performed for a dispute which is still open.

column.name: DSP_AUT_ACTION_COD
column.comment: The action to be performed on the dispute action date, if the dispute is still open.

column.name: DCC_IND
column.comment: This field indicates whether the adjustment should update the DCC.

column.name: EU_ORIGINAL_AMT
column.comment: This is the original amount (including tax), in Euro, when the dispute was opened.

column.name: EFFECTIVE_DATE
column.comment: effective date

column.name: CRD_CHG_SEQ_NO
column.comment: This is the entity sequence number of the charge that was created as a result of a dispute approval.

column.name: FILLER
column.comment: N/A
